body_html:
So, I opened the x64 Native Tools Command Prompt for Visual Studio 2017 after installing the proper components from the Indivdual Components tab of the Visual Studio 2017 installer.

I ensured that MAGMA_HOME was set properly as a system environment variable to the location where I downloaded the MAGMA files. (In my case, it was: C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\magma_cuda90_release)

I then ran:

cd C:\src\pytorch_source\pytorch-scripts\pytorch
python setup.py clean
call C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\Miniconda3\Scripts\activate C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\Miniconda3
python setup.py clean
cd C:\src\pytorch_source\pytorch-scripts
"C:\Program Files (x86)\IntelSWTools\compilers_and_libraries_2018.1.156\windows\mkl\bin\mklvars.bat" intel64
cuda90.bat

and it appeared to run to completion without errors!

body:
So, I opened the x64 Native Tools Command Prompt for Visual Studio 2017 after installing the proper components from the Indivdual Components tab of the Visual Studio 2017 installer. 

I ensured that MAGMA_HOME was set properly as a system environment variable to the location where I downloaded the MAGMA files. (In my case, it was: C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\magma_cuda90_release)

I then ran:

`cd C:\src\pytorch_source\pytorch-scripts\pytorch`
`python setup.py clean`
`call C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\Miniconda3\Scripts\activate C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\Miniconda3`
`python setup.py clean`
`cd C:\src\pytorch_source\pytorch-scripts`
`"C:\Program Files (x86)\IntelSWTools\compilers_and_libraries_2018.1.156\windows\mkl\bin\mklvars.bat" intel64`
`cuda90.bat`

and it appeared to run to completion without errors!
